alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:20AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm producing torrential rainfall will impact portions of central El Paso County through 100 AM MDT... At 1220 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Security, or near Colorado Springs, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colorado Springs, Fountain, Stratmoor, Schriever AFB, Fort Carson, Security, Peterson AFB, Security-Widefield, Falcon and Cimarron Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
